com.github.dm.jrt.core.invocation

Interface Invocation<IN,OUT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input data type.
    OUT - the output data type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CallInvocation, CommandInvocation, IdentityInvocation, InvocationDecorator, MappingInvocation, RoutineInvocation, TemplateInvocation

    public interface Invocation<IN,OUT>
    Interface defining a routine invocation.

    The typical lifecycle of an invocation object is the one depicted below: 

         

                     -----------------
                     }     <init>    {
                     -----------------
        ---------------      |     |
       |               |     |      --(*)--------------------------
       |               V     V                  |                  |
       |             -----------------          |                  |
       |    ---------| onInitialize()|---(*)----                   |
       |   |         -----------------                             |
       |   |    -------      |     |                               |
       |   |   |       |     |      -----------------              |
       |   |   |       V     V                       |             |
       |   |   |     -----------------               |             |
       |   |    -----|   onInput()   |---------      |             |
       |   |         -----------------   |     |     |             |
       |    -----------      |           |     V     V             |
       |               |     |           |   -----------------     |
       |               V     V          (*)  |   onAbort()   |     |
       |             -----------------   |   -----------------     |
       |             |   onResult()  |---        |       |         |
       |             -----------------           |       |         |
       |                     |      -------------       (*)        |
       |                     |     |                     |         |
       |                     V     V                     |         |
       |             -----------------                   |         |
        -------------| onTerminate() |                   |         |
                     -----------------                   |         |
                             |      -------------------------------
                             |     |
                             V     V
                     -----------------
                     }  onDestroy()  {
                     -----------------


      (*) if exception is thrown
    The routine invocation interface is designed so to allow recycling of instantiated objects.

    Note that the onInput() method will be called for each input passed to the routine, so, in case no input is expected, the onResult() method will be called soon after the initialization.

    Note also that onAbort() might be called at any time between onInitialize() and onTerminate() in case the execution is aborted.
    The only case in which the onTerminate() method does not get call at all, is when an exception escapes the onAbort() method invocation.

    The onTerminate() method is meant to allow the clean up and reset operations needed to prepare the invocation object to be reused. When the method is not called or does not complete successfully, the invocation object is discarded.
    While the onDestroy() method is meant to indicate that the invocation object is no longer needed, so any associated resource can be safely released. Note that this method may never get called if the routine is automatically garbage collected.

    Keep in mind, when implementing an invocation class, that the result channel passed to the onInput() and onResult() methods will be closed as soon as the latter exits.
    Any further attempt to post results will generate an exception.
    It is anyway possible to keep on generating results by passing to the result channel an output or an I/O channel.

    Be aware that there is no guarantee about how and when an invocation will produce a result. It might return one or more output for each input, or no output at all.

    Any exception escaping the invocation methods, unless it extends the base RoutineException, will be wrapped as the cause of an InvocationException instance.

    The class TemplateInvocation provides an abstract empty implementation of the invocation interface.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 09/07/2014.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAbort(RoutineException reason)
      Called when the routine execution is aborted.
      void onDestroy()
      Called when the routine invocation is no longer needed.
      void onInitialize()
      Called when the routine invocation is initialized.
      void onInput(IN input, ResultChannel<OUT> result)
      Called when an input is passed to the routine.
      void onResult(ResultChannel<OUT> result)
      Called when all the inputs has been passed to the routine.
      void onTerminate()
      Called when the invocation execution has completed.

    • Method Detail

      • onAbort

        void onAbort(@NotNull
             RoutineException reason)
      throws Exception
        Called when the routine execution is aborted.
        This method may be called at any time after the invocation initialization.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason of the abortion.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onDestroy

        void onDestroy()
        throws Exception
        Called when the routine invocation is no longer needed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onInitialize

        void onInitialize()
           throws Exception
        Called when the routine invocation is initialized.
        This is always the first method in the invocation lifecycle.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onInput

        void onInput(IN input,
             @NotNull
             ResultChannel<OUT> result)
      throws Exception
        Called when an input is passed to the routine.
        This method is called once for each input object.
        Parameters:
        input - the input.
        result - the result channel.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onResult

        void onResult(@NotNull
              ResultChannel<OUT> result)
       throws Exception
        Called when all the inputs has been passed to the routine.
        This method is called once in the invocation lifecycle to indicate that the final invocation results should be passed to the result channel.
        Parameters:
        result - the result channel.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.

      • onTerminate

        void onTerminate()
          throws Exception
        Called when the invocation execution has completed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an unexpected error occurs.
